Described Disease.Disease Name: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS) and Parkinson's Disease

Experiment Method.Material Used: Transgenic mouse brain tissue and wild-type controls
Experiment Method.Readout Type: Quantitative (protein expression levels of TDP-43 and α-synuclein)
Experiment Method.Conclusion: R497H mutation in TDP-43 increases aggregation, while α-synuclein oligomers correlate with neurodegeneration
Experiment Method.Molecular Effect: Enhanced TDP-43 aggregation and α-synuclein toxicity
Experiment Method.Approved Assay: Yes (commonly used in neurodegenerative disease research)

Experiment Method.Material Used: Postmortem brain tissue from ALS patients with LRRK2 p.G2019S mutation
Experiment Method.Readout Type: Qualitative (neuronal loss and Lewy body pathology)
Experiment Method.Conclusion: LRRK2 p.G2019S mutation correlates with accelerated Lewy body formation
Experiment Method.Molecular Effect: Increased phosphorylation of LRRK2 and α-synuclein
Experiment Method.Approved Assay: Yes (standard in Parkinson's disease pathology studies)

Experiment Method.Material Used: SOD1 p.A147T transgenic mice and wild-type controls
Experiment Method.Readout Type: Quantitative (neuronal firing rates and action potential duration)
Experiment Method.Conclusion: SOD1 p.A147T mutation causes rapid motor neuron degeneration
Experiment Method.Molecular Effect: Impaired potassium channel function and increased excitotoxicity
Experiment Method.Controls: Wild-type mice and SOD1 WT transgenic mice

Thresholds.Normal: Firing rate ≥ 5 Hz, action potential duration ≤ 2.5 ms
Thresholds.Abnormal: Firing rate < 2 Hz, action potential duration > 3.5 ms

Experiment Method.Approved Assay: Yes (gold standard for motor neuron function assessment)
